instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Liquid spill on the board near <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> i clean the board with ultrasonic, i remake solder of <CHIP>U9000</CHIP>.
I change the fuse F9800 and <TRANSISTOR>Q8608</TRANSISTOR>, but always no backlight. i check the connector of lcd for short, but i don't see anything.
<TRANSISTOR>Q8606</TRANSISTOR> and F9800 are dead when i plug the screen.
can you help me please?
thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Check for short with LCD connected

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Ok i have really a short in the LCD, i change <TRANSISTOR>Q8608</TRANSISTOR> again and i have <SIGNAL>BCKLIGT_EN_DIV</SIGNAL>= 12,08V and  <SIGNAL>LCD_BCKLT_FUSED</SIGNAL>= 12,50V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S0_LCDBKLT_PWR</SIGNAL>=0,806V i don't understand why, the screen is not plug, the impedance of <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S0_LCDBKLT_PWR</SIGNAL> is 3K7 ohm.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Without LCD plugged in there will never be backlight voltage. Fix the short, probably bad cable or bad LCD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: I try with a good LCD and i have always <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S0_LCDBKLT_PWR</SIGNAL>=0,3V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Do you even have an image? Voltages on <TRANSISTOR>Q9806</TRANSISTOR>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
yes the image is dark but with flashlight i see.
<SIGNAL>BCKLIGT_EN_DIV</SIGNAL>= 12,08V
<SIGNAL>LCD_BCKLT_FUSED</SIGNAL>= 12,50V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S0_LCDBKLT_PWR</SIGNAL>=0,3V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Was that tested with LCD connected?

Voltages on <TRANSISTOR>Q9807</TRANSISTOR> pin 2 and 5. LCD must be connected of course.
